oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reparation claim of John Houston Bills for Civil War damages
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Claim of Bills, a large Hardeman Co. planter & slaveowner, for "property destroyed by fire by the U.S. soldiers" on May 5, 1864. In the claim, Bills attests to the fact that he has "never voluntarily borne arms against the Government of the United States, for the purpose, or with the intention, of aiding the late rebellion." Original in the Hardeman County Archives microfilmed and available for research at Tennessee State Library and Archives (Hardeman County Loose Records, Roll A-19,438).
